name: Kodlak Whitemane

aspects.trouble: Burdened by the Curse of Lycanthropy and His Impending Fate
other_aspects: Mentor and Father Figure to Skyrim's Warriors

stunts: Harbinger's Wisdom: Once per session, Kodlak can use his deep insight (Rapport) in place of Lore to guide a Companion or player through a moral dilemma.
Inner Beast Tamed: +2 to Will when resisting bloodlust or the influence of his lycanthropy during tense situations.

trust_clock.description: Represents Kodlak's trust and respect for the party, increased by deeds of honor and helping the Companions.

relationships.The Companions: Harbinger (leader and caretaker of this warrior guild)
relationships.Aela the Huntress: Trusted member of the Circle (like a daughter to him)
relationships.Player (as Companion): Evaluating as a potential successor (if the player joins the Companions)
relationships.Silver Hand: Bitter enemies (they target his family of Companions)
relationships.Jarl Balgruuf: Respects the Jarl, maintains a cordial relationship with Whiterun's leadership

personality_notes.speaking_style: Soft-spoken, reflective, and authoritative. Kodlak often sounds more like a sage than a warrior, with a Nord's gravelly undertone tempered by great patience.
motivations: Guide the Companions to live honorably and uphold their legacy
Find a cure for the Circle's lycanthropy and his own soul's peace
Ensure the Companions stay out of petty politics and focus on honor
fears: Dying without curing himself and the Circle (being claimed by Hircine instead of entering Sovngarde)
The Companions losing their way or honor after he is gone
His werewolf nature causing harm to those he cares about or innocent people
quirks: Frequently gazes into the flame of the Jorrvaskr hearth while in thought
Polishes old weapons or armor while telling stories of past heroes
Has a faraway look when talk of Sovngarde or the afterlife comes up

combat_tactics: Kodlak fights only when necessary; as an elder warrior he is still formidable. In battle, he prefers a greatsword or battleaxe, using measured, powerful strikes. If utterly forced, he can call upon his beast blood (werewolf form), but he considers it a last resort and is ashamed to use it. He coordinates with his fellow Companions, trusting younger fighters to take point while he bolsters them and strikes decisive blows.
scene_triggers: Introducing the player to the Companions (if they seek to join)
Companion quests briefing or advice scenes at Jorrvaskr
The moment the Silver Hand strike or when a Circle member dies (his personal quest trigger)
Battle of Whiterun involvement if the Companions step in to defend the city's people
